conclusion: Analyze velocity-time graphs of Cars A and B to determine positions at different times.

Car A's graph is a straight line with a constant velocity of 40 m/s from t = 10s to t = 20s, and then remains at this velocity. Car B's graph is a straight line with a constant velocity of 20 m/s from t = 10s to t = 30s.
At t = 10 seconds, both cars have the same velocity of 40 m/s.
From t = 10 seconds to t = 20 seconds, Car A maintains a velocity of 40 m/s.
From t = 10 seconds to t = 30 seconds, Car B maintains a velocity of 20 m/s.
Since Car A is traveling at a higher velocity than Car B during this period, Car A will cover more distance than Car B.
At t = 30 seconds, both cars are side by side, indicating that Car A was ahead of Car B during the interval from t = 10 seconds to t = 30 seconds.
Therefore, at t = 10 seconds, Car A is ahead of Car B.
Car A is ahead of Car B.
